description: Originated c. 1595–1605, verdure +‎ -ous, ultimately from verd (“green”), from Latin viridis.

adjectives.description: verdurous (comparative more verdurous, superlative most verdurous)

entries.meaning: Freshly green; verdant; covered with verdure, or consisting of it.
examples: The hill was blanketed in verdurous grasses.
